Title: Adding Tables from a Data Area to a Semantic Model Instance _ Community
Author: Christian Hauggaard
Text: There are two ways to add tables, or fields,from a data area to a Semantic Model instance, this article covers both of these options below.

Lists.heading: Drag-and-drop from Data Area
list: Open the relevant Data Warehouse instance and data area which contains the tables you would like to move to the semantic model
Drag-and-drop the table from the data area to your semantic model

Lists.heading: Drag-and-drop from Source Database Browser
list: Open the Semantic Model instance and click on the Semantic Model instance name
The Source Database Browser appears in the right-hand pane. Select the relevant data area from the dropdown, which contains the tables that you would like to bring into your semantic model instance
Drag-and-drop the table from the Source Database Browser into your semantic model instance. Once a table has been added, fields can also be added using drag-and-drop
